100rel.name: 100rel
100rel.synopsis: Allow support for RFC3262 provisional ACK tags

aggregate_mwi.name: aggregate_mwi
aggregate_mwi.synopsis: Condense MWI notifications into a single NOTIFY.
aggregate_mwi.description: When enabled, "aggregate_mwi" condenses message waiting notifications from multiple mailboxes into a single NOTIFY. If it is disabled, individual NOTIFYs are sent for each mailbox.

aors.name: aors
aors.synopsis: AoR(s) to be used with the endpoint
aors.description: List of comma separated AoRs that the endpoint should be associated with.

auth.name: auth
auth.synopsis: Authentication Object(s) associated with the endpoint
auth.description:
This is a comma-delimited list of "auth" sections defined in "pjsip.conf" to be used to verify inbound connection attempts.
Endpoints without an authentication object configured will allow connections without verification.
auth.note: Using the same auth section for inbound and outbound authentication is not recommended. There is a difference in meaning for an empty realm setting between inbound and outbound authentication uses. See the auth realm description for details.

callerid.name: callerid
callerid.description: Must be in the format "Name <Number>", or only "<Number>".

direct_media_glare_mitigation.name: direct_media_glare_mitigation
direct_media_glare_mitigation.description:
This setting attempts to avoid creating INVITE glare scenarios by disabling direct media reINVITEs in one direction thereby allowing designated servers (according to this option) to initiate direct media reINVITEs without contention and significantly reducing call setup time.
A more detailed description of how this option functions can be found on the Asterisk wiki https://wiki.asterisk.org/wiki/display/AST/SIP+Direct+Media+Reinvite+Glare+Avoidance

direct_media_method.name: direct_media_method
direct_media_method.description: Method for setting up Direct Media between endpoints.

connected_line_method.name: connected_line_method
connected_line_method.description: Method used when updating connected line information.

choices.invite: When set to "invite", check the remote's Allow header and if UPDATE is allowed, send UPDATE instead of INVITE to avoid SDP renegotiation. If UPDATE is not Allowed, send INVITE.
choices.update: If set to "update", send UPDATE regardless of what the remote Allows.

direct_media.name: direct_media
direct_media.synopsis: Determines whether media may flow directly between endpoints.

disable_direct_media_on_nat.name: disable_direct_media_on_nat
disable_direct_media_on_nat.synopsis: Disable direct media session refreshes when NAT obstructs the media session

dtmf_mode.name: dtmf_mode
dtmf_mode.description: This setting allows to choose the DTMF mode for endpoint communication.

choices.rfc4733: DTMF is sent out of band of the main audio stream. This supercedes the older "RFC-2833" used within the older "chan_sip".
choices.inband: DTMF is sent as part of audio stream.
choices.info: DTMF is sent as SIP INFO packets.
choices.auto: DTMF is sent as RFC 4733 if the other side supports it or as INBAND if not.
choices.auto_info: DTMF is sent as RFC 4733 if the other side supports it or as SIP INFO if not.

media_address.name: media_address
media_address.synopsis: IP address used in SDP for media handling
media_address.description: At the time of SDP creation, the IP address defined here will be used as the media address for individual streams in the SDP.
media_address.note: Be aware that the "external_media_address" option, set in Transport configuration, can also affect the final media address used in the SDP.

bind_rtp_to_media_address.name: bind_rtp_to_media_address
bind_rtp_to_media_address.synopsis: Bind the RTP instance to the media_address
bind_rtp_to_media_address.description: If media_address is specified, this option causes the RTP instance to be bound to the specified ip address which causes the packets to be sent from that address.

ice_support.name: ice_support
ice_support.synopsis: Enable the ICE mechanism to help traverse NAT

identify_by.name: identify_by
identify_by.synopsis: Way(s) for the endpoint to be identified
identify_by.description: Endpoints and AORs can be identified in multiple ways. This option is a comma separated list of methods the endpoint can be identified.
identify_by.note: This option controls both how an endpoint is matched for incoming traffic and also how an AOR is determined if a registration occurs. You must list at least one method that also matches for AORs or the registration will fail.

choices.username: Matches the endpoint or AOR ID based on the username and domain in the From header (or To header for AORs). If an exact match on both username and domain/realm fails, the match is retried with just the username.
choices.auth_username: Matches the endpoint or AOR ID based on the username and realm in the Authentication header. If an exact match on both username and domain/realm fails, the match is retried with just the username.
choices.ip:
Matches the endpoint based on the source IP address.
This method of identification is not configured here but simply allowed by this configuration option. See the documentation for the "identify" configuration section for more details on this method of endpoint identification.
choices.header:
Matches the endpoint based on a configured SIP header value.
This method of identification is not configured here but simply allowed by this configuration option. See the documentation for the "identify" configuration section for more details on this method of endpoint identification.

redirect_method.name: redirect_method
redirect_method.synopsis: How redirects received from an endpoint are handled
redirect_method.description: When a redirect is received from an endpoint there are multiple ways it can be handled. If this option is set to "user" the user portion of the redirect target is treated as an extension within the dialplan and dialed using a Local channel. If this option is set to "uri_core" the target URI is returned to the dialing application which dials it using the PJSIP channel driver and endpoint originally used. If this option is set to "uri_pjsip" the redirect occurs within chan_pjsip itself and is not exposed to the core at all. The "uri_pjsip" option has the benefit of being more efficient and also supporting multiple potential redirect targets. The con is that since redirection occurs within chan_pjsip redirecting information is not forwarded and redirection can not be prevented.

mailboxes.name: mailboxes
mailboxes.synopsis: NOTIFY the endpoint when state changes for any of the specified mailboxes
mailboxes.description:
Asterisk will send unsolicited MWI NOTIFY messages to the endpoint when state changes happen for any of the specified mailboxes. More than one mailbox can be specified with a comma-delimited string. app_voicemail mailboxes must be specified as mailbox@context; for example: mailboxes=6001@default. For mailboxes provided by external sources, such as through the res_external_mwi module, you must specify strings supported by the external system.
For endpoints that SUBSCRIBE for MWI, use the "mailboxes" option in your AOR configuration.

mwi_subscribe_replaces_unsolicited.name: mwi_subscribe_replaces_unsolicited
mwi_subscribe_replaces_unsolicited.synopsis: An MWI subscribe will replace sending unsolicited NOTIFYs

voicemail_extension.name: voicemail_extension
voicemail_extension.synopsis: The voicemail extension to send in the NOTIFY Message-Account header

outbound_auth.name: outbound_auth
outbound_auth.synopsis: Authentication object(s) used for outbound requests
outbound_auth.description: This is a comma-delimited list of "auth" sections defined in "pjsip.conf" used to respond to outbound connection authentication challenges.
outbound_auth.note: Using the same auth section for inbound and outbound authentication is not recommended. There is a difference in meaning for an empty realm setting between inbound and outbound authentication uses. See the auth realm description for details.

outbound_proxy.name: outbound_proxy
outbound_proxy.synopsis: Full SIP URI of the outbound proxy used to send requests

rewrite_contact.name: rewrite_contact
rewrite_contact.synopsis: Allow Contact header to be rewritten with the source IP address-port
rewrite_contact.description: On inbound SIP messages from this endpoint, the Contact header or an appropriate Record-Route header will be changed to have the source IP address and port. This option does not affect outbound messages sent to this endpoint. This option helps servers communicate with endpoints that are behind NATs. This option also helps reuse reliable transport connections such as TCP and TLS.

rtp_ipv6.name: rtp_ipv6
rtp_ipv6.synopsis: Allow use of IPv6 for RTP traffic

rtp_symmetric.name: rtp_symmetric
rtp_symmetric.synopsis: Enforce that RTP must be symmetric

send_diversion.name: send_diversion
send_diversion.synopsis: Send the Diversion header, conveying the diversion information to the called user agent

rpid_immediate.name: rpid_immediate
rpid_immediate.synopsis: Immediately send connected line updates on unanswered incoming calls.
rpid_immediate.description:
When enabled, immediately send "180 Ringing" or "183 Progress" response messages to the caller if the connected line information is updated before the call is answered. This can send a "180 Ringing" response before the call has even reached the far end. The caller can start hearing ringback before the far end even gets the call. Many phones tend to grab the first connected line information and refuse to update the display if it changes. The first information is not likely to be correct if the call goes to an endpoint not under the control of this Asterisk box.
When disabled, a connected line update must wait for another reason to send a message with the connected line information to the caller before the call is answered. You can trigger the sending of the information by using an appropriate dialplan application such as "Ringing".

timers_min_se.name: timers_min_se
timers_min_se.description: Minimum session timer expiration period. Time in seconds.

timers_sess_expires.name: timers_sess_expires
timers_sess_expires.description: Maximum session timer expiration period. Time in seconds.

transport.name: transport
transport.description: This will "force" the endpoint to use the specified transport configuration to send SIP messages. You need to already know what kind of transport (UDP/TCP/IPv4/etc) the endpoint device will use.
transport.note: Not specifying a transport will select the first configured transport in "pjsip.conf" which is compatible with the URI we are trying to contact.

trust_id_inbound.name: trust_id_inbound
trust_id_inbound.synopsis: Accept identification information received from this endpoint
trust_id_inbound.description: This option determines whether Asterisk will accept identification from the endpoint from headers such as P-Asserted-Identity or Remote-Party-ID header. This option applies both to calls originating from the endpoint and calls originating from Asterisk. If "no", the configured Caller-ID from pjsip.conf will always be used as the identity for the endpoint.

trust_id_outbound.name: trust_id_outbound
trust_id_outbound.synopsis: Send private identification details to the endpoint.
trust_id_outbound.description: This option determines whether res_pjsip will send private identification information to the endpoint. If "no", private Caller-ID information will not be forwarded to the endpoint. "Private" in this case refers to any method of restricting identification. Example: setting "callerid_privacy" to any "prohib" variation. Example: If "trust_id_inbound" is set to "yes", the presence of a "Privacy: id" header in a SIP request or response would indicate the identification provided in the request is private.

use_avpf.name: use_avpf
use_avpf.synopsis: Determines whether res_pjsip will use and enforce usage of AVPF for this endpoint.
use_avpf.description:
If set to "yes", res_pjsip will use the AVPF or SAVPF RTP profile for all media offers on outbound calls and media updates and will decline media offers not using the AVPF or SAVPF profile.
If set to "no", res_pjsip will use the AVP or SAVP RTP profile for all media offers on outbound calls and media updates, and will decline media offers not using the AVP or SAVP profile.

force_avp.name: force_avp
force_avp.synopsis: Determines whether res_pjsip will use and enforce usage of AVP, regardless of the RTP profile in use for this endpoint.
force_avp.description:
If set to "yes", res_pjsip will use the AVP, AVPF, SAVP, or SAVPF RTP profile for all media offers on outbound calls and media updates including those for DTLS-SRTP streams.
If set to "no", res_pjsip will use the respective RTP profile depending on configuration.

media_use_received_transport.name: media_use_received_transport
media_use_received_transport.synopsis: Determines whether res_pjsip will use the media transport received in the offer SDP in the corresponding answer SDP.
media_use_received_transport.description:
If set to "yes", res_pjsip will use the received media transport.
If set to "no", res_pjsip will use the respective RTP profile depending on configuration.

media_encryption.name: media_encryption
media_encryption.synopsis: Determines whether res_pjsip will use and enforce usage of media encryption for this endpoint.

media_encryption_optimistic.name: media_encryption_optimistic
media_encryption_optimistic.synopsis: Determines whether encryption should be used if possible but does not terminate the session if not achieved.
media_encryption_optimistic.description: This option only applies if "media_encryption" is set to "sdes" or "dtls".

g726_non_standard.name: g726_non_standard
g726_non_standard.synopsis: Force g.726 to use AAL2 packing order when negotiating g.726 audio
g726_non_standard.description: When set to "yes" and an endpoint negotiates g.726 audio then use g.726 for AAL2 packing order instead of what is recommended by RFC3551. Since this essentially replaces the underlying 'g726' codec with 'g726aal2' then 'g726aal2' needs to be specified in the endpoint's allowed codec list.

inband_progress.name: inband_progress
inband_progress.synopsis: Determines whether chan_pjsip will indicate ringing using inband progress.
inband_progress.description:
If set to "yes", chan_pjsip will send a 183 Session Progress when told to indicate ringing and will immediately start sending ringing as audio.
If set to "no", chan_pjsip will send a 180 Ringing when told to indicate ringing and will NOT send it as audio.

call_group.name: call_group
call_group.synopsis: The numeric pickup groups for a channel.
call_group.description: Can be set to a comma separated list of numbers or ranges between the values of 0-63 (maximum of 64 groups).

pickup_group.name: pickup_group
pickup_group.synopsis: The numeric pickup groups that a channel can pickup.
pickup_group.description: Can be set to a comma separated list of numbers or ranges between the values of 0-63 (maximum of 64 groups).

named_call_group.name: named_call_group
named_call_group.synopsis: The named pickup groups for a channel.
named_call_group.description: Can be set to a comma separated list of case sensitive strings limited by supported line length.

named_pickup_group.name: named_pickup_group
named_pickup_group.synopsis: The named pickup groups that a channel can pickup.
named_pickup_group.description: Can be set to a comma separated list of case sensitive strings limited by supported line length.

device_state_busy_at.name: device_state_busy_at
device_state_busy_at.synopsis: The number of in-use channels which will cause busy to be returned as device state
device_state_busy_at.description: When the number of in-use channels for the endpoint matches the devicestate_busy_at setting the PJSIP channel driver will return busy as the device state instead of in use.

t38_udptl.name: t38_udptl
t38_udptl.synopsis: Whether T.38 UDPTL support is enabled or not
t38_udptl.description: If set to yes T.38 UDPTL support will be enabled, and T.38 negotiation requests will be accepted and relayed.

t38_udptl_maxdatagram.name: t38_udptl_maxdatagram
t38_udptl_maxdatagram.description: This option can be set to override the maximum datagram of a remote endpoint for broken endpoints.

fax_detect.name: fax_detect
fax_detect.synopsis: Whether CNG tone detection is enabled
fax_detect.description: This option can be set to send the session to the fax extension when a CNG tone is detected.

fax_detect_timeout.name: fax_detect_timeout
fax_detect_timeout.synopsis: How long into a call before fax_detect is disabled for the call
fax_detect_timeout.description: The option determines how many seconds into a call before the fax_detect option is disabled for the call. Setting the value to zero disables the timeout.

t38_udptl_nat.name: t38_udptl_nat
t38_udptl_nat.synopsis: Whether NAT support is enabled on UDPTL sessions
t38_udptl_nat.description: When enabled the UDPTL stack will send UDPTL packets to the source address of received packets.

t38_udptl_ipv6.name: t38_udptl_ipv6
t38_udptl_ipv6.synopsis: Whether IPv6 is used for UDPTL Sessions
t38_udptl_ipv6.description: When enabled the UDPTL stack will use IPv6.

tone_zone.name: tone_zone
tone_zone.synopsis: Set which country's indications to use for channels created for this endpoint.

language.name: language
language.synopsis: Set the default language to use for channels created for this endpoint.

one_touch_recording.name: one_touch_recording
one_touch_recording.synopsis: Determines whether one-touch recording is allowed for this endpoint.

record_on_feature.name: record_on_feature
record_on_feature.synopsis: The feature to enact when one-touch recording is turned on.
record_on_feature.description: When an INFO request for one-touch recording arrives with a Record header set to "on", this feature will be enabled for the channel. The feature designated here can be any built-in or dynamic feature defined in features.conf.
record_on_feature.note: This setting has no effect if the endpoint's one_touch_recording option is disabled

record_off_feature.name: record_off_feature
record_off_feature.synopsis: The feature to enact when one-touch recording is turned off.
record_off_feature.description: When an INFO request for one-touch recording arrives with a Record header set to "off", this feature will be enabled for the channel. The feature designated here can be any built-in or dynamic feature defined in features.conf.
record_off_feature.note: This setting has no effect if the endpoint's one_touch_recording option is disabled

rtp_engine.name: rtp_engine
rtp_engine.synopsis: Name of the RTP engine to use for channels created for this endpoint

allow_transfer.name: allow_transfer
allow_transfer.synopsis: Determines whether SIP REFER transfers are allowed for this endpoint

user_eq_phone.name: user_eq_phone
user_eq_phone.synopsis: Determines whether a user=phone parameter is placed into the request URI if the user is determined to be a phone number

moh_passthrough.name: moh_passthrough
moh_passthrough.synopsis: Determines whether hold and unhold will be passed through using re-INVITEs with recvonly and sendrecv to the remote side

sdp_owner.name: sdp_owner
sdp_owner.synopsis: String placed as the username portion of an SDP origin (o=) line.

sdp_session.name: sdp_session
sdp_session.synopsis: String used for the SDP session (s=) line.

tos_audio.name: tos_audio
tos_audio.synopsis: DSCP TOS bits for audio streams
tos_audio.description: See https://wiki.asterisk.org/wiki/display/AST/IP+Quality+of+Service for more information about QoS settings

tos_video.name: tos_video
tos_video.synopsis: DSCP TOS bits for video streams
tos_video.description: See https://wiki.asterisk.org/wiki/display/AST/IP+Quality+of+Service for more information about QoS settings

cos_audio.name: cos_audio
cos_audio.description: See https://wiki.asterisk.org/wiki/display/AST/IP+Quality+of+Service for more information about QoS settings

cos_video.name: cos_video
cos_video.description: See https://wiki.asterisk.org/wiki/display/AST/IP+Quality+of+Service for more information about QoS settings

allow_subscribe.name: allow_subscribe
allow_subscribe.synopsis: Determines if endpoint is allowed to initiate subscriptions with Asterisk.

sub_min_expiry.name: sub_min_expiry
sub_min_expiry.synopsis: The minimum allowed expiry time for subscriptions initiated by the endpoint.

from_user.name: from_user
from_user.synopsis: Username to use in From header for requests to this endpoint.

mwi_from_user.name: mwi_from_user
mwi_from_user.synopsis: Username to use in From header for unsolicited MWI NOTIFYs to this endpoint.

from_domain.name: from_domain
from_domain.synopsis: Domain to user in From header for requests to this endpoint.

dtls_verify.name: dtls_verify
dtls_verify.synopsis: Verify that the provided peer certificate is valid
dtls_verify.description: This option only applies if "media_encryption" is set to "dtls".

dtls_rekey.name: dtls_rekey
dtls_rekey.synopsis: Interval at which to renegotiate the TLS session and rekey the SRTP session
dtls_rekey.description:
This option only applies if "media_encryption" is set to "dtls".
If this is not set or the value provided is 0 rekeying will be disabled.

dtls_auto_generate_cert.name: dtls_auto_generate_cert
dtls_auto_generate_cert.synopsis: Whether or not to automatically generate an ephemeral X.509 certificate
dtls_auto_generate_cert.description: If enabled, Asterisk will generate an X.509 certificate for each DTLS session. This option only applies if "media_encryption" is set to "dtls". This option will be automatically enabled if "webrtc" is enabled and "dtls_cert_file" is not specified.

dtls_cert_file.name: dtls_cert_file
dtls_cert_file.synopsis: Path to certificate file to present to peer
dtls_cert_file.description: This option only applies if "media_encryption" is set to "dtls".

dtls_private_key.name: dtls_private_key
dtls_private_key.synopsis: Path to private key for certificate file
dtls_private_key.description: This option only applies if "media_encryption" is set to "dtls".

dtls_cipher.name: dtls_cipher
dtls_cipher.synopsis: Cipher to use for DTLS negotiation
dtls_cipher.description:
This option only applies if "media_encryption" is set to "dtls".
Many options for acceptable ciphers. See link for more:
http://www.openssl.org/docs/apps/ciphers.html#CIPHER_STRINGS

dtls_ca_file.name: dtls_ca_file
dtls_ca_file.description: This option only applies if "media_encryption" is set to "dtls".

dtls_ca_path.name: dtls_ca_path
dtls_ca_path.synopsis: Path to a directory containing certificate authority certificates
dtls_ca_path.description: This option only applies if "media_encryption" is set to "dtls".

dtls_setup.name: dtls_setup
dtls_setup.synopsis: Whether we are willing to accept connections, connect to the other party, or both.
dtls_setup.description: This option only applies if "media_encryption" is set to "dtls".

dtls_fingerprint.name: dtls_fingerprint
dtls_fingerprint.synopsis: Type of hash to use for the DTLS fingerprint in the SDP.
dtls_fingerprint.description: This option only applies if "media_encryption" is set to "dtls".

srtp_tag_32.name: srtp_tag_32
srtp_tag_32.synopsis: Determines whether 32 byte tags should be used instead of 80 byte tags.
srtp_tag_32.description: This option only applies if "media_encryption" is set to "sdes" or "dtls".

set_var.name: set_var
set_var.synopsis: Variable set on a channel involving the endpoint.
set_var.description: When a new channel is created using the endpoint set the specified variable(s) on that channel. For multiple channel variables specify multiple 'set_var'(s).

message_context.name: message_context
message_context.synopsis: Context to route incoming MESSAGE requests to.
message_context.description: If specified, incoming MESSAGE requests will be routed to the indicated dialplan context. If no "message_context" is specified, then the "context" setting is used.

accountcode.name: accountcode
accountcode.synopsis: An accountcode to set automatically on any channels created for this endpoint.
accountcode.description: If specified, any channel created for this endpoint will automatically have this accountcode set on it.

preferred_codec_only.name: preferred_codec_only
preferred_codec_only.synopsis: Respond to a SIP invite with the single most preferred codec rather than advertising all joint codec capabilities. This limits the other side's codec choice to exactly what we prefer.

rtp_keepalive.name: rtp_keepalive
rtp_keepalive.synopsis: Number of seconds between RTP comfort noise keepalive packets.
rtp_keepalive.description: At the specified interval, Asterisk will send an RTP comfort noise frame. This may be useful for situations where Asterisk is behind a NAT or firewall and must keep a hole open in order to allow for media to arrive at Asterisk.

rtp_timeout.name: rtp_timeout
rtp_timeout.synopsis: Maximum number of seconds without receiving RTP (while off hold) before terminating call.
rtp_timeout.description: This option configures the number of seconds without RTP (while off hold) before considering a channel as dead. When the number of seconds is reached the underlying channel is hung up. By default this option is set to 0, which means do not check.

rtp_timeout_hold.name: rtp_timeout_hold
rtp_timeout_hold.synopsis: Maximum number of seconds without receiving RTP (while on hold) before terminating call.
rtp_timeout_hold.description: This option configures the number of seconds without RTP (while on hold) before considering a channel as dead. When the number of seconds is reached the underlying channel is hung up. By default this option is set to 0, which means do not check.

acl.name: acl
acl.synopsis: List of IP ACL section names in acl.conf
acl.description: This matches sections configured in "acl.conf". The value is defined as a list of comma-delimited section names.

deny.name: deny
deny.synopsis: List of IP addresses to deny access from
deny.description: The value is a comma-delimited list of IP addresses. IP addresses may have a subnet mask appended. The subnet mask may be written in either CIDR or dotted-decimal notation. Separate the IP address and subnet mask with a slash ('/')

permit.name: permit
permit.synopsis: List of IP addresses to permit access from
permit.description: The value is a comma-delimited list of IP addresses. IP addresses may have a subnet mask appended. The subnet mask may be written in either CIDR or dotted-decimal notation. Separate the IP address and subnet mask with a slash ('/')

contact_acl.name: contact_acl
contact_acl.synopsis: List of Contact ACL section names in acl.conf
contact_acl.description: This matches sections configured in "acl.conf". The value is defined as a list of comma-delimited section names.

contact_deny.name: contact_deny
contact_deny.synopsis: List of Contact header addresses to deny
contact_deny.description: The value is a comma-delimited list of IP addresses. IP addresses may have a subnet mask appended. The subnet mask may be written in either CIDR or dotted-decimal notation. Separate the IP address and subnet mask with a slash ('/')

contact_permit.name: contact_permit
contact_permit.synopsis: List of Contact header addresses to permit
contact_permit.description: The value is a comma-delimited list of IP addresses. IP addresses may have a subnet mask appended. The subnet mask may be written in either CIDR or dotted-decimal notation. Separate the IP address and subnet mask with a slash ('/')

subscribe_context.name: subscribe_context
subscribe_context.description: If specified, incoming SUBSCRIBE requests will be searched for the matching extension in the indicated context. If no "subscribe_context" is specified, then the "context" setting is used.

contact_user.name: contact_user
contact_user.synopsis: Force the user on the outgoing Contact header to this value.
contact_user.description: On outbound requests, force the user portion of the Contact header to this value.

asymmetric_rtp_codec.name: asymmetric_rtp_codec
asymmetric_rtp_codec.synopsis: Allow the sending and receiving RTP codec to differ
asymmetric_rtp_codec.description: When set to "yes" the codec in use for sending will be allowed to differ from that of the received one. PJSIP will not automatically switch the sending one to the receiving one.

rtcp_mux.name: rtcp_mux
rtcp_mux.synopsis: Enable RFC 5761 RTCP multiplexing on the RTP port
rtcp_mux.description: With this option enabled, Asterisk will attempt to negotiate the use of the "rtcp-mux" attribute on all media streams. This will result in RTP and RTCP being sent and received on the same port. This shifts the demultiplexing logic to the application rather than the transport layer. This option is useful when interoperating with WebRTC endpoints since they mandate this option's use.

refer_blind_progress.name: refer_blind_progress
refer_blind_progress.synopsis: Whether to notifies all the progress details on blind transfer
refer_blind_progress.description: Some SIP phones (Mitel/Aastra, Snom) expect a sip/frag "200 OK" after REFER has been accepted. If set to "no" then asterisk will not send the progress details, but immediately will send "200 OK".

notify_early_inuse_ringing.name: notify_early_inuse_ringing
notify_early_inuse_ringing.synopsis: Whether to notifies dialog-info 'early' on InUse&Ringing state
notify_early_inuse_ringing.description: Control whether dialog-info subscriptions get 'early' state on Ringing when already INUSE.

max_audio_streams.name: max_audio_streams
max_audio_streams.synopsis: The maximum number of allowed audio streams for the endpoint
max_audio_streams.description: This option enforces a limit on the maximum simultaneous negotiated audio streams allowed for the endpoint.

max_video_streams.name: max_video_streams
max_video_streams.synopsis: The maximum number of allowed video streams for the endpoint
max_video_streams.description: This option enforces a limit on the maximum simultaneous negotiated video streams allowed for the endpoint.

bundle.name: bundle
bundle.description: With this option enabled, Asterisk will attempt to negotiate the use of bundle. If negotiated this will result in multiple RTP streams being carried over the same underlying transport. Note that enabling bundle will also enable the rtcp_mux option.

webrtc.name: webrtc
webrtc.synopsis: Defaults and enables some options that are relevant to WebRTC
webrtc.description:
When set to "yes" this also enables the following values that are needed in order for basic WebRTC support to work: rtcp_mux, use_avpf, ice_support, and use_received_transport. The following configuration settings also get defaulted as follows:
media_encryption=dtls
dtls_auto_generate_cert=yes (if dtls_cert_file is not set)
dtls_verify=fingerprint
dtls_setup=actpass

incoming_mwi_mailbox.name: incoming_mwi_mailbox
incoming_mwi_mailbox.synopsis: Mailbox name to use when incoming MWI NOTIFYs are received
incoming_mwi_mailbox.description: If an MWI NOTIFY is received "from" this endpoint, this mailbox will be used when notifying other modules of MWI status changes. If not set, incoming MWI NOTIFYs are ignored.

follow_early_media_fork.name: follow_early_media_fork
follow_early_media_fork.synopsis: Follow SDP forked media when To tag is different
follow_early_media_fork.description: On outgoing calls, if the UAS responds with different SDP attributes on subsequent 18X or 2XX responses (such as a port update) AND the To tag on the subsequent response is different than that on the previous one, follow it. This usually happens when the INVITE is forked to multiple UASs and more than one sends an SDP answer.
follow_early_media_fork.note: This option must also be enabled in the "system" section for it to take effect here.

accept_multiple_sdp_answers.name: accept_multiple_sdp_answers
accept_multiple_sdp_answers.synopsis: Accept multiple SDP answers on non-100rel responses
accept_multiple_sdp_answers.description: On outgoing calls, if the UAS responds with different SDP attributes on non-100rel 18X or 2XX responses (such as a port update) AND the To tag on the subsequent response is the same as that on the previous one, process the updated SDP. This can happen when the UAS needs to change ports for some reason such as using a separate port for custom ringback.
accept_multiple_sdp_answers.note: This option must also be enabled in the "system" section for it to take effect here.

suppress_q850_reason_headers.name: suppress_q850_reason_headers
suppress_q850_reason_headers.synopsis: Suppress Q.850 Reason headers for this endpoint
suppress_q850_reason_headers.description: Some devices can't accept multiple Reason headers and get confused when both 'SIP' and 'Q.850' Reason headers are received. This option allows the 'Q.850' Reason header to be suppressed.

auth_type.name: auth_type
auth_type.description: This option specifies which of the password style config options should be read when trying to authenticate an endpoint inbound request. If set to "userpass" then we'll read from the 'password' option. For "md5" we'll read from 'md5_cred'.

nonce_lifetime.name: nonce_lifetime
nonce_lifetime.synopsis: Lifetime of a nonce associated with this authentication config.

password.name: password
password.synopsis: Plain text password used for authentication.

realm.name: realm
realm.description:
The treatment of this value depends upon how the authentication object is used.
When used as an inbound authentication object, the realm is sent as part of the challenge so the peer can know which key to use when responding. An empty value will use the "global" section's "default_realm" value when issuing a challenge.
When used as an outbound authentication object, the realm is matched with the received challenge realm to determine which authentication object to use when responding to the challenge. An empty value matches any challenging realm when determining which authentication object matches a received challenge.
realm.note: Using the same auth section for inbound and outbound authentication is not recommended. There is a difference in meaning for an empty realm setting between inbound and outbound authentication uses.

bind.name: bind
bind.synopsis: IP Address and optional port to bind to for this transport

ca_list_file.name: ca_list_file
ca_list_file.synopsis: File containing a list of certificates to read (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

ca_list_path.name: ca_list_path
ca_list_path.synopsis: Path to directory containing a list of certificates to read (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

cert_file.name: cert_file
cert_file.synopsis: Certificate file for endpoint (TLS ONLY, not WSS)
cert_file.description: A path to a .crt or .pem file can be provided. However, only the certificate is read from the file, not the private key. The "priv_key_file" option must supply a matching key file.

cipher.name: cipher
cipher.synopsis: Preferred cryptography cipher names (TLS ONLY, not WSS)
cipher.description:
Comma separated list of cipher names or numeric equivalents. Numeric equivalents can be either decimal or hexadecimal (0xX).
There are many cipher names. Use the CLI command "pjsip list ciphers" to see a list of cipher names available for your installation. See link for more:
http://www.openssl.org/docs/apps/ciphers.html#CIPHER_SUITE_NAMES

external_media_address.name: external_media_address
external_media_address.synopsis: External IP address to use in RTP handling
external_media_address.description: When a request or response is sent out, if the destination of the message is outside the IP network defined in the option "localnet", and the media address in the SDP is within the localnet network, then the media address in the SDP will be rewritten to the value defined for "external_media_address".

method.name: method
method.synopsis: Method of SSL transport (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

choices.default: The default as defined by PJSIP. This is currently TLSv1, but may change with future releases.
choices.unspecified: This option is equivalent to setting 'default'

local_net.name: local_net
local_net.synopsis: Network to consider local (used for NAT purposes).
local_net.description: This must be in CIDR or dotted decimal format with the IP and mask separated with a slash ('/').

priv_key_file.name: priv_key_file
priv_key_file.synopsis: Private key file (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

protocol.name: protocol
protocol.synopsis: Protocol to use for SIP traffic

require_client_cert.name: require_client_cert
require_client_cert.synopsis: Require client certificate (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

verify_client.name: verify_client
verify_client.synopsis: Require verification of client certificate (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

verify_server.name: verify_server
verify_server.synopsis: Require verification of server certificate (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

tos.name: tos
tos.synopsis: Enable TOS for the signalling sent over this transport
tos.description: See "https://wiki.asterisk.org/wiki/display/AST/IP+Quality+of+Service" for more information on this parameter.
tos.note: This option does not apply to the "ws" or the "wss" protocols.

cos.name: cos
cos.synopsis: Enable COS for the signalling sent over this transport
cos.description: See "https://wiki.asterisk.org/wiki/display/AST/IP+Quality+of+Service" for more information on this parameter.
cos.note: This option does not apply to the "ws" or the "wss" protocols.

websocket_write_timeout.name: websocket_write_timeout
websocket_write_timeout.synopsis: The timeout (in milliseconds) to set on WebSocket connections.
websocket_write_timeout.description: If a websocket connection accepts input slowly, the timeout for writes to it can be increased to keep it from being disconnected. Value is in milliseconds; default is 100 ms.

allow_reload.name: allow_reload
allow_reload.synopsis: Allow this transport to be reloaded.
allow_reload.description: Allow this transport to be reloaded when res_pjsip is reloaded. This option defaults to "no" because reloading a transport may disrupt in-progress calls.

symmetric_transport.name: symmetric_transport
symmetric_transport.synopsis: Use the same transport for outgoing requests as incoming ones.
symmetric_transport.description: When a request from a dynamic contact comes in on a transport with this option set to 'yes', the transport name will be saved and used for subsequent outgoing requests like OPTIONS, NOTIFY and INVITE. It's saved as a contact uri parameter named 'x-ast-txp' and will display with the contact uri in CLI, AMI, and ARI output. On the outgoing request, if a transport wasn't explicitly set on the endpoint AND the request URI is not a hostname, the saved transport will be used and the 'x-ast-txp' parameter stripped from the outgoing packet.

expiration_time.name: expiration_time
expiration_time.synopsis: Time to keep alive a contact
expiration_time.description: Time to keep alive a contact. String style specification.

qualify_frequency.name: qualify_frequency
qualify_frequency.synopsis: Interval at which to qualify a contact
qualify_frequency.description: Interval between attempts to qualify the contact for reachability. If "0" never qualify. Time in seconds.

qualify_timeout.name: qualify_timeout
qualify_timeout.description: If the contact doesn't respond to the OPTIONS request before the timeout, the contact is marked unavailable. If "0" no timeout. Time in fractional seconds.

authenticate_qualify.name: authenticate_qualify
authenticate_qualify.synopsis: Authenticates a qualify challenge response if needed
authenticate_qualify.description: If true and a qualify request receives a challenge response then authentication is attempted before declaring the contact available.
authenticate_qualify.note: This option does nothing as we will always complete the challenge response authentication if the qualify request is challenged.

outbound_proxy.name: outbound_proxy
outbound_proxy.synopsis: Outbound proxy used when sending OPTIONS request
outbound_proxy.description: If set the provided URI will be used as the outbound proxy when an OPTIONS request is sent to a contact for qualify purposes.

path.name: path
path.synopsis: Stored Path vector for use in Route headers on outgoing requests.

user_agent.name: user_agent
user_agent.description: The User-Agent is automatically stored based on data present in incoming SIP REGISTER requests and is not intended to be configured manually.

endpoint.name: endpoint
endpoint.description: The name of the endpoint this contact belongs to

reg_server.name: reg_server
reg_server.description: Asterisk Server name on which SIP endpoint registered.

via_addr.name: via_addr
via_addr.synopsis: IP-address of the last Via header from registration.
via_addr.description: The last Via header should contain the address of UA which sent the request. The IP-address of the last Via header is automatically stored based on data present in incoming SIP REGISTER requests and is not intended to be configured manually.

via_port.name: via_port
via_port.synopsis: IP-port of the last Via header from registration.
via_port.description: The IP-port of the last Via header is automatically stored based on data present in incoming SIP REGISTER requests and is not intended to be configured manually.

call_id.name: call_id
call_id.description: The Call-ID header is automatically stored based on data present in incoming SIP REGISTER requests and is not intended to be configured manually.

prune_on_boot.name: prune_on_boot
prune_on_boot.synopsis: A contact that cannot survive a restart/boot.
prune_on_boot.description: The option is set if the incoming SIP REGISTER contact is rewritten on a reliable transport and is not intended to be configured manually.

contact.name: contact
contact.description:
Contacts specified will be called whenever referenced by "chan_pjsip".
Use a separate "contact=" entry for each contact required. Contacts are specified using a SIP URI.

default_expiration.name: default_expiration
default_expiration.synopsis: Default expiration time in seconds for contacts that are dynamically bound to an AoR.

mailboxes.name: mailboxes
mailboxes.synopsis: Allow subscriptions for the specified mailbox(es)
mailboxes.description:
This option applies when an external entity subscribes to an AoR for Message Waiting Indications. The mailboxes specified will be subscribed to. More than one mailbox can be specified with a comma-delimited string. app_voicemail mailboxes must be specified as mailbox@context; for example: mailboxes=6001@default. For mailboxes provided by external sources, such as through the res_external_mwi module, you must specify strings supported by the external system.
For endpoints that cannot SUBSCRIBE for MWI, you can set the "mailboxes" option in your endpoint configuration section to enable unsolicited MWI NOTIFYs to the endpoint.

voicemail_extension.name: voicemail_extension
voicemail_extension.synopsis: The voicemail extension to send in the NOTIFY Message-Account header

maximum_expiration.name: maximum_expiration
maximum_expiration.synopsis: Maximum time to keep an AoR
maximum_expiration.description: Maximum time to keep a peer with explicit expiration. Time in seconds.

max_contacts.name: max_contacts
max_contacts.synopsis: Maximum number of contacts that can bind to an AoR
max_contacts.description: Maximum number of contacts that can associate with this AoR. This value does not affect the number of contacts that can be added with the "contact" option. It only limits contacts added through external interaction, such as registration.
max_contacts.note:
The "rewrite_contact" option registers the source address as the contact address to help with NAT and reusing connection oriented transports such as TCP and TLS. Unfortunately, refreshing a registration may register a different contact address and exceed "max_contacts". The "remove_existing" option can help by removing the soonest to expire contact(s) over "max_contacts" which is likely the old "rewrite_contact" contact source address being refreshed.
This should be set to "1" and "remove_existing" set to "yes" if you wish to stick with the older "chan_sip" behaviour.

minimum_expiration.name: minimum_expiration
minimum_expiration.synopsis: Minimum keep alive time for an AoR
minimum_expiration.description: Minimum time to keep a peer with an explicit expiration. Time in seconds.

remove_existing.name: remove_existing
remove_existing.synopsis: Determines whether new contacts replace existing ones.
remove_existing.description: On receiving a new registration to the AoR should it remove enough existing contacts not added or updated by the registration to satisfy "max_contacts"? Any removed contacts will expire the soonest.
remove_existing.note:
The "rewrite_contact" option registers the source address as the contact address to help with NAT and reusing connection oriented transports such as TCP and TLS. Unfortunately, refreshing a registration may register a different contact address and exceed "max_contacts". The "remove_existing" option can help by removing the soonest to expire contact(s) over "max_contacts" which is likely the old "rewrite_contact" contact source address being refreshed.
This should be set to "yes" and "max_contacts" set to "1" if you wish to stick with the older "chan_sip" behaviour.

qualify_frequency.name: qualify_frequency
qualify_frequency.synopsis: Interval at which to qualify an AoR
qualify_frequency.description: Interval between attempts to qualify the AoR for reachability. If "0" never qualify. Time in seconds.

qualify_timeout.name: qualify_timeout
qualify_timeout.description: If the contact doesn't respond to the OPTIONS request before the timeout, the contact is marked unavailable. If "0" no timeout. Time in fractional seconds.

authenticate_qualify.name: authenticate_qualify
authenticate_qualify.synopsis: Authenticates a qualify challenge response if needed
authenticate_qualify.description: If true and a qualify request receives a challenge response then authentication is attempted before declaring the contact available.
authenticate_qualify.note: This option does nothing as we will always complete the challenge response authentication if the qualify request is challenged.

outbound_proxy.name: outbound_proxy
outbound_proxy.synopsis: Outbound proxy used when sending OPTIONS request
outbound_proxy.description: If set the provided URI will be used as the outbound proxy when an OPTIONS request is sent to a contact for qualify purposes.

support_path.name: support_path
support_path.synopsis: Enables Path support for REGISTER requests and Route support for other requests.
support_path.description: When this option is enabled, the Path headers in register requests will be saved and its contents will be used in Route headers for outbound out-of-dialog requests and in Path headers for outbound 200 responses. Path support will also be indicated in the Supported header.

timer_t1.name: timer_t1
timer_t1.description: Timer T1 is the base for determining how long to wait before retransmitting requests that receive no response when using an unreliable transport (e.g. UDP). For more information on this timer, see RFC 3261, Section 17.1.1.1.

timer_b.name: timer_b
timer_b.description: Timer B determines the maximum amount of time to wait after sending an INVITE request before terminating the transaction. It is recommended that this be set to 64 * Timer T1, but it may be set higher if desired. For more information on this timer, see RFC 3261, Section 17.1.1.1.

compact_headers.name: compact_headers
compact_headers.synopsis: Use the short forms of common SIP header names.

threadpool_initial_size.name: threadpool_initial_size
threadpool_initial_size.synopsis: Initial number of threads in the res_pjsip threadpool.

threadpool_auto_increment.name: threadpool_auto_increment
threadpool_auto_increment.synopsis: The amount by which the number of threads is incremented when necessary.

threadpool_idle_timeout.name: threadpool_idle_timeout
threadpool_idle_timeout.synopsis: Number of seconds before an idle thread should be disposed of.

threadpool_max_size.name: threadpool_max_size
threadpool_max_size.synopsis: Maximum number of threads in the res_pjsip threadpool. A value of 0 indicates no maximum.

disable_tcp_switch.name: disable_tcp_switch
disable_tcp_switch.synopsis: Disable automatic switching from UDP to TCP transports.
disable_tcp_switch.description: Disable automatic switching from UDP to TCP transports if outgoing request is too large. See RFC 3261 section 18.1.1.

follow_early_media_fork.name: follow_early_media_fork
follow_early_media_fork.synopsis: Follow SDP forked media when To tag is different
follow_early_media_fork.description: On outgoing calls, if the UAS responds with different SDP attributes on subsequent 18X or 2XX responses (such as a port update) AND the To tag on the subsequent response is different than that on the previous one, follow it.
follow_early_media_fork.note: This option must also be enabled on endpoints that require this functionality.

accept_multiple_sdp_answers.name: accept_multiple_sdp_answers
accept_multiple_sdp_answers.synopsis: Follow SDP forked media when To tag is the same
accept_multiple_sdp_answers.description: On outgoing calls, if the UAS responds with different SDP attributes on non-100rel 18X or 2XX responses (such as a port update) AND the To tag on the subsequent response is the same as that on the previous one, process the updated SDP.
accept_multiple_sdp_answers.note: This option must also be enabled on endpoints that require this functionality.

type.name: type
type.synopsis: Must be of type 'system' UNLESS the object name is 'system'.

max_forwards.name: max_forwards
max_forwards.synopsis: Value used in Max-Forwards header for SIP requests.

keep_alive_interval.name: keep_alive_interval
keep_alive_interval.synopsis: The interval (in seconds) to send keepalives to active connection-oriented transports.

contact_expiration_check_interval.name: contact_expiration_check_interval
contact_expiration_check_interval.synopsis: The interval (in seconds) to check for expired contacts.

disable_multi_domain.name: disable_multi_domain
disable_multi_domain.description: If disabled it can improve realtime performance by reducing the number of database requests.

max_initial_qualify_time.name: max_initial_qualify_time
max_initial_qualify_time.synopsis: The maximum amount of time from startup that qualifies should be attempted on all contacts. If greater than the qualify_frequency for an aor, qualify_frequency will be used instead.

unidentified_request_period.name: unidentified_request_period
unidentified_request_period.synopsis: The number of seconds over which to accumulate unidentified requests.
unidentified_request_period.description: If "unidentified_request_count" unidentified requests are received during "unidentified_request_period", a security event will be generated.

unidentified_request_count.name: unidentified_request_count
unidentified_request_count.synopsis: The number of unidentified requests from a single IP to allow.
unidentified_request_count.description: If "unidentified_request_count" unidentified requests are received during "unidentified_request_period", a security event will be generated.

unidentified_request_prune_interval.name: unidentified_request_prune_interval
unidentified_request_prune_interval.synopsis: The interval at which unidentified requests are older than twice the unidentified_request_period are pruned.

type.name: type
type.synopsis: Must be of type 'global' UNLESS the object name is 'global'.

user_agent.name: user_agent
user_agent.synopsis: Value used in User-Agent header for SIP requests and Server header for SIP responses.

regcontext.name: regcontext
regcontext.synopsis: When set, Asterisk will dynamically create and destroy a NoOp priority 1 extension for a given peer who registers or unregisters with us.

default_outbound_endpoint.name: default_outbound_endpoint
default_outbound_endpoint.synopsis: Endpoint to use when sending an outbound request to a URI without a specified endpoint.

default_voicemail_extension.name: default_voicemail_extension
default_voicemail_extension.synopsis: The voicemail extension to send in the NOTIFY Message-Account header if not specified on endpoint or aor

debug.name: debug
debug.synopsis: Enable/Disable SIP debug logging. Valid options include yes|no or a host address

endpoint_identifier_order.name: endpoint_identifier_order
endpoint_identifier_order.synopsis: The order by which endpoint identifiers are processed and checked. Identifier names are usually derived from and can be found in the endpoint identifier module itself (res_pjsip_endpoint_identifier_*). You can use the CLI command "pjsip show identifiers" to see the identifiers currently available.
endpoint_identifier_order.note: One of the identifiers is "auth_username" which matches on the username in an Authentication header. This method has some security considerations because an Authentication header is not present on the first message of a dialog when digest authentication is used. The client can't generate it until the server sends the challenge in a 401 response. Since Asterisk normally sends a security event when an incoming request can't be matched to an endpoint, using auth_username requires that the security event be deferred until a request is received with the Authentication header and only generated if the username doesn't result in a match. This may result in a delay before an attack is recognized. You can control how many unmatched requests are received from a single ip address before a security event is generated using the unidentified_request parameters.

default_from_user.name: default_from_user
default_from_user.synopsis: When Asterisk generates an outgoing SIP request, the From header username will be set to this value if there is no better option (such as CallerID) to be used.

default_realm.name: default_realm
default_realm.synopsis: When Asterisk generates a challenge, the digest realm will be set to this value if there is no better option (such as auth/realm) to be used.

mwi_tps_queue_high.name: mwi_tps_queue_high
mwi_tps_queue_high.synopsis: MWI taskprocessor high water alert trigger level.
mwi_tps_queue_high.description: On a heavily loaded system you may need to adjust the taskprocessor queue limits. If any taskprocessor queue size reaches its high water level then pjsip will stop processing new requests until the alert is cleared. The alert clears when all alerting taskprocessor queues have dropped to their low water clear level.

mwi_tps_queue_low.name: mwi_tps_queue_low
mwi_tps_queue_low.synopsis: MWI taskprocessor low water clear alert level.
mwi_tps_queue_low.description: On a heavily loaded system you may need to adjust the taskprocessor queue limits. If any taskprocessor queue size reaches its high water level then pjsip will stop processing new requests until the alert is cleared. The alert clears when all alerting taskprocessor queues have dropped to their low water clear level.
mwi_tps_queue_low.note: Set to -1 for the low water level to be 90% of the high water level.

mwi_disable_initial_unsolicited.name: mwi_disable_initial_unsolicited
mwi_disable_initial_unsolicited.synopsis: Enable/Disable sending unsolicited MWI to all endpoints on startup.
mwi_disable_initial_unsolicited.description:
When the initial unsolicited MWI notification are enabled on startup then the initial notifications get sent at startup. If you have a lot of endpoints (thousands) that use unsolicited MWI then you may want to consider disabling the initial startup notifications.
When the initial unsolicited MWI notifications are disabled on startup then the notifications will start on the endpoint's next contact update.

ignore_uri_user_options.name: ignore_uri_user_options
ignore_uri_user_options.synopsis: Enable/Disable ignoring SIP URI user field options.
ignore_uri_user_options.description: If you have this option enabled and there are semicolons in the user field of a SIP URI then the field is truncated at the first semicolon. This effectively makes the semicolon a non-usable character for PJSIP endpoint names, extensions, and AORs. This can be useful for improving compatibility with an ITSP that likes to use user options for whatever reason.
ignore_uri_user_options.note: The caller-id and redirecting number strings obtained from incoming SIP URI user fields are always truncated at the first semicolon.
